meanings.definition: Make or become flat or flatter.
meanings.sent1: She flattens the dough before baking it.
meanings.sent2: The steamroller flattens the road to make it smooth.
meanings.sent3: The cat flattens itself on the warm pavement, enjoying the sun.
meanings.sent4: His harsh words flatten her spirit like a heavy weight.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake flattens entire buildings in seconds, leaving only rubble behind.

meanings.definition: Remove air from (a tire or other inflated object).
meanings.sent1: He flattens the tire to fix the puncture.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic flattens the tire to check for leaks.
meanings.sent3: The prankster secretly flattens all the tires in the parking lot.
meanings.sent4: The deflating balloon slowly flattens as the air escapes.
meanings.sent5: The hissing sound indicates the tire is flattening rapidly.

meanings.sent1: The boring lecture flattens the enthusiasm of the students.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather flattens the mood of the outdoor party.
meanings.sent3: His bad jokes always manage to flatten the room with awkward silence.
meanings.sent4: The news of the cancellation flattens her excitement for the event.
meanings.sent5: The monotonous tone of the speaker flattens the energy in the room.
